intro: Trisetum altaicum, commonly known as the tall bluegrass, is a perennial grass species native to North America. It is characterized by its fine, blue-green blades and is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has slender, cylindrical stems. Its inflorescence consists of a single, narrow spike that bears small, spikelet-like flowers. Trisetum altaicum plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
